diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Resistance to Thyroid Hormone (RTH) due to homozygous mutations in the THRB gene
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The clinical findings included compromised intellectual development, tachycardia, goiter, growth retardation, and hearing loss, which were more severe than those seen in heterozygous cases. The mutations resulted in a strong dominant-negative effect on the thyroid hormone receptor function, supported by clinical and laboratory abnormalities consistent with RTH.
